I believe that role of this function is similar to numpy.asarray. In this case I see a reason to use original name, for instance:

def make_computations(x, backend=np):
    x = backend.asarray(x)
    return backend.log(backend.exp(x).sum()) # some complex computations instead of this

This trick was particularly useful for theano, when same function could be used with numpy and theano.

body:
I believe that role of this function is similar to `numpy.asarray`. In this case I see a reason to use original name, for instance:

```python
def make_computations(x, backend=np):
    x = backend.asarray(x)
    return backend.log(backend.exp(x).sum()) # some complex computations instead of this
```

This trick was particularly useful for theano, when same function could be used with numpy and theano.
